results.title: The World of semi conductors
results.creator_credit: A E I and Michael Oitom
results.brief_description: Describes the electrical properties of semiconductor materials, the effects of adding various controlled impurities, and the way in which semiconductors can be used for rectification or as amplifiers. Examples of both applications are shown, ranging from the minute transistorised transmitter in a radio pill for medical research to the banks of semiconductor rectifiers on heavy duty electric railway locomotives. Sketches the manufacturing process involved and examines the possibility of using semiconductors for power generation, central heating and refrigeration.

results.title: The World of PVC
results.creator_credit: British Geo Ltd, Dormar Productions, John G. Berry and Bob Kellett
results.brief_description: PVC is the most versatile plastic of all and thiis film is about the process and manufacture of PVC. Tells about its low maintenance and long-lasting protective function. Some if its uses include: 33 1/3 records, raincoats, floor coverings, wallets and briefcases, covers for barges, car and haystacks, and pipes for building industry. PVC is made from oil and coal.

results.title: The World of Peter Rabbit and friends
results.creator_credit: TVC London, Frederick Warne and Company and John Coates
results.brief_description: The delightful drawings and stories of Beatrix Potter are stunningly recreated in this excellent series. From the mischievious Peter Rabbit and his near fatal encounter with Mr. McGregor, to Jemima Puddle-duck and her naive trust in the Fox, these stories will entertain and stimulate young minds.

results.title: The World of David Milne
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly, Colin Low and Gerald Budner
results.brief_description: A lively, exciting experience of art, from the words and paintings of David Milne. “Art”, he said, “isn’t a fire in the grass; it’s an explosion.” Milne’s letters read as a commentary, tell how he felt about what he painted, how he tried to catch the essence of his feelings “before the power ran out…like escaping steam”. We see many of his paintings and a sequence in which we observe the development of his own unique style.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly, Colin Low and Gerald Budner

results.title: The World of CRA
results.brief_description: Views of the varied interests of the group of companies associated with Conzinc Riotinto of Australia. Mining iron at Hamersley; lead, silver and zinc at Broken Hill; aluminium at Weipa; uranium at Rum Jungle; and mineral sands at North Stradbroke Island. Treatment of ores, refining of metals, research and exploration in Australia and New Guinea. Intended to replace the film “Mineral Heritage”, released 1965. Shows Australia’s abundant wealth in minerals, and the part C.R.A plays in mining and processing them. Shows the continuing search for new deposits, especially around Papua and New Guinea and in Bass Strait, and research into the potential of the minerals.

results.title: The World of cashmere
results.creator_credit: British Information Services, Lionel Hoare and Frederick Goode
results.brief_description: The story of cashmere wool from the combing of the strands from the goat’s fleeces in the Himalayas, where the animals are reared to the making of knitted goods at Hawick in Scotland. Concentrates on the manufacturing processes, particularly dyeing, emphasizing the care that is taken throughout to maintain quality.
